ygData.subject: Re: Skills
ygData.msgSnippet: I would not count fishing in that analysis... I too am very sure that fishing has a cap... or at least it does for my character on Cazic-Thull. (it seems to be
ygData.messageBody:
I would not count fishing in that analysis... I too am very sure that
fishing has a cap... or at least it does for my character on Cazic-Thull.

(it seems to be the level+5 times 5)

----- Original Message -----
From: Lomack <lomack@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 10:38 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Skills


> From: Lomack <lomack@...>
>
> Trade Skills I know for sure do not have a level cap for skill. I have a
> friend who is a Dark Elf Necromancer on Fennin Ro. At level 17 he has a
> Smihting skill 126. By the level+1 times 5 rule he should be maxed at 85.
> However, this is not the case. Any of the trade skills as well as
swimming
> (yes I am counting Fishing as a trade skill) have a 255 skill cap but none
> other based on level that I have seen.
>
> Lomack
>
> >
> >Message: 16
> > Date: Tue, 4 May 1999 08:43:42 -0400
> > From: "McGraw, T. David" <Mcgraw.Thomas@...>
> >Subject: Re: Skills
> >
> >All skills have a cap based on level now. This was implemented towards
the
> >end of the beta contrary to what Brad preached about not having to kill
bats
> >to become a better fisherman.
> >
> >Yours,
> >
> >~Aereuss Ravins of Tarew Marr
> >
> >PS -- I have not tested this with any trade skill other than fishing, if
> >anyone has any information on those please let me know.
> >
>
> Long Live the Brotherhood,
> Lomack, BCK-MoR
>
>

> Join today.
>
